    How to explore the projects graphically

    how-to-explore-the-projects-graphically.Rmd
    library(goodpracticestools)

    How to explore the distribution of projects by type A / B / C / D

    The data was prepared using the prepare_data() function. See the article How to prepare data for statistical analysis for more details.

    data("data_fr")

    The projects are linked to one or more of these types:

    A - Nutrition focus for children/teenagers B - Nutrition focus for the elderly C - Mental health focus for children/teenagers D - Mental health focus for the elderly

    The plot_distrib_type() function displays the distribution of observations across one of these types.

    get_distrib_type_data(
  data = data_fr
) |>
plot_distrib_type(
  title_font_size = 16, 
  text_font_size = 10
)

    Note: Some projects are associated with more than one type. Others are not associated with any type.

    The German version is also available:

    get_distrib_type_data(
  data = data_fr
) |>
plot_distrib_type(
  title_font_size = 16, 
  text_font_size = 8.5, 
  language = "de"
)

    How to explore the distribution of projects by level

    The data was prepared using the prepare_data() function. See the article How to prepare data for statistical analysis for more details.

    data("data_fr")

    The projects are linked to one or more of these levels:

    • Policy
    • Networking
    • Public Information
    • Intervention

    The plot_distrib_level() function displays the distribution of observations across one of these levels.

    get_distrib_level_data(
  data = data_fr
) |>
plot_distrib_level(
  title_font_size = 16, 
  text_font_size = 10
)

    The German version is also available:

    get_distrib_level_data(
  data = data_fr
) |>
plot_distrib_level(
  title_font_size = 16, 
  text_font_size = 10, 
  language = "de"
)

    How to explore the raw data about the projects 

    data("data_raw_fr")

    The function show_raw_data() allows displaying the raw data:

    show_raw_data(
  data = data_raw_fr
)

    The German version is also available:

    data("data_raw_de")
    show_raw_data(
  data = data_raw_de, 
  language = "de"
)
